entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as the one who killed Harry's father, indicating his evil and powerful nature.

entities.name: professor umbridge
entities.description: Professor Umbridge is described as having a blank face, which suggests she is hiding her true feelings or intentions. She is also mentioned as speaking in a soft and sweet voice.

entities.name: mr. potter
entities.description: Mr. Potter (Harry) is the main character of the story, who is being addressed by Professor Umbridge. He is described as feeling angry and not caring about what happens next.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as one of Harry's classmates, who is sitting nearby when Professor Umbridge addresses Harry.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as one of Harry's classmates, who is sitting nearby when Professor Umbridge addresses Harry.

relationships.description: Voldemort killed Mr. Potter's father, indicating a past event that has had a significant impact on Harry.
Professor Umbridge addresses Mr. Potter directly, indicating a formal or official relationship between them.
